entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Won Lok Sabha with bigger margin than PM: Engineer Rashid exclusiveIn his first interview after walking out of Tihar jail on interim bail ahead of Jammu and Kashmir election, Rashid said, "I secured more votes from Baramulla than PM Modi did from Varanasi."

Ready to quit, says Mamata Banerjee as protesting doctors skip meetingMamata Banerjee's statement came after the doctors refused to hold a meeting with the government for the third straight day, demanding a larger delegation and a live-telecast of the meeting.

BJP's 'Manmohan Singh's Iftar' counter to row over PM's Ganpati with Chief JusticeBJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla shared an old picture of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh hosting an iftar party at his residence in 2009, which was attended by then Chief Justice of India KG Balakrishnan among others.

Leading light of the Left: PM Modi condoles Sitaram Yechury's deathIn a statement, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Sitaram Yechury was a leading light of the Left and was known for his ability to connect across the political spectrum.

How to stop being indecisive as an adultIndecisiveness can delay making crucial decisions, which can result in missed opportunities and higher stress levels, affecting your mental well-being, professional life, and relationships.

Watch: PM Modi sits on floor as Paralympic javelin star Navdeep gifts him a cap Paralympics 2024: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a special gift from javelin star Navdeep Singh. PM Modi also signed an autograph for the gold medalist on his throwing arm during their meeting on Thursday, September 12. para

Is Engineer Rashid BJP's proxy for Jammu and Kashmir polls? Union Minister says...Speaking at 'Panchayat AajTak' event, Union Minister Jitendra Singh spoke about the Opposition's claim about Baramulla MP Engineer Rashid being a "BJP proxy".

Taylor Swift, Donald Trump, and bad blood between them. Also, the US electionTaylor Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris is more headline-grabbing than a political debate. But, will her 'Fearless' stance shake up Trump's chances in 2024 election?

This X user claims Elon Musk never got a reply from Taylor Swift onlineAn X user has 'figured' out that Elon Musk has often replied to Taylor Swift's posts or accounts that tagged her, but the pop star never responded.

How ex-IRS officer helped over 3 lakh aspirants fulfill their IAS dreamMeet former IRS officer Ravi Kapoor, who is empowering UPSC aspirants to succeed in the IAS examination. Through his 'Free Mentorship Programme,' he has offered tailored guidance to over 3 lakh candidates.

What to do when your lip fillers go wrong Everyone wants fuller lips these days, but if lip fillers aren't done right, things can go wrong pretty fast. Here's what you should do if your lip fillers don't look right.

Army officers thrashed, woman friend gang-raped in Madhya PradeshThe incident happened when the two Major rank officers, who were undergoing training at Army War College in Madhya Pradesh's Mhow, were out on a picnic with their two female friends on September 11.

Polaris Dawn's billionaire pilot leads world's first private spacewalkThe primary objective of the spacewalk was to test SpaceX's newly developed EVA suits, which are designed for future long-duration missions to the Moon and Mars.

Veteran CPM leader Sitaram Yechury dies at 72, body to be donated to AIIMSCPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury died on Thursday following prolonged illness. Top political leaders, including PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi and Mamata Banerjee, condoled his death.
Stress is good for sperm. A new study says soA new study reveals that stress impacts sperm motility, or its ability to move through the female reproductive system to fertilise an egg.

Sitaram Yechury: Left stalwart who made Indira Gandhi resign as JNU chancellorSitaram Yechury Death News: The suave and affable Marxist, who had good relations with leaders across the political divide, passed away in Delhi on Thursday at 72.
Semi-naked, headless body of woman found on Kanpur-Delhi highwayUttar Pradesh Police said the woman's bones and teeth were broken. The police are yet to make a breakthrough in the case.

Indian-origin Israeli soldier killed in West Bank attackA 24-year-old Indian-origin Israeli soldier from the Bnei Menashe community was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack near Beit El settlement in the West Bank. The soldier, Staff Sergeant Geri Gideon Hanghal, was a member of the Kfir Brigade's Nahshon Battalion.

Manipur Police has procured machine guns, but why?Manipur Police has procured 7.62 mm medium machine guns (MMGs) and requested the Army to train its personnel in their use. The procurement, amid rising drone and missile attacks by militants on civilians, raises questions about why the Manipur Police is getting armed with a weapon not generally used by the police or paramilitary forces.

Will Smith congratulates 'mama, papa' Deepika Padukone-Ranveer Singh Actor Will Smith congratulated new parents Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh. The couple welcomed their first child, a baby girl, on Sunday, September 8.

Gavaskar slams Vaughan over 'Joe Root surpassing Sachin Tendulkar' remarkBatting great Sunil Gavaskar responded to Michael Vaughan's remarks about Joe Root potentially surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's Test run record, dismissing claims that the BCCI neglects Test cricket. Gavaskar criticized the notion of "Indian bashing" and defended India's commitment to the longest format.

OTD in 2023: Rohit Sharma surpasses Sachin to become 2nd fastest to 10,000 runsRohit Sharma became the second fastest to reach 10,000 ODI runs during the Asia Cup 2023 against Sri Lanka. He achieved the milestone in 241 innings, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's record.

Rohan Bopanna all set to make debut in Tennis Premier League Season 6Rohan Bopanna is all set to make his debut in the Tennis Premier League season 6. Bopanna will be one of the big names involved with the league this season.

Australia call up Ben Dwarshuis after Xavier Bartlett's side strainENG vs AUS: Ben Dwarshuis has been added as a cover to the Australian squad after Xavier Bartlett suffered a side strain in the first T20I on Wednesday in Southampton.

Kishan shines with hundred after late inclusion in India C in Duleep TrophyDuleep Trophy 2024: Ishan Kishan shone with the bat on his return to the Duleep Trophy for India C against India B in Anantapur. He notched up his 7th first-class hundred within 119 balls.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
